intro: Cephalangraecum straussii, commonly known as the Schomburgkia, is a rare and striking member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the humid, shaded understories of tropical rainforests in South America, particularly in Brazil and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, an adaptation to its often-dry environments. Its flowers are showy, with vibrant colors that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
